result.execSummary:
The defendant James Anthony Garrett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Payable through Clerk of Court.
Payment plan approved.

32 Session AODA with follow through.
If completed will drop jail time from 10 months to 9 months.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: From DE's mother on 10-23-17 re: notice rec'd.  Ret'd call to DE's mother, Carol & advised her that a courtesy Reminder Notice was sent because pymt was rec'd 5 days late.  DE's mother stated she receives her ck on the 3rd of ea mo & pymt will likely be late.  Carol was advised that her son will continue to get Reminder Notices & she may call to ensure pymt was rec'd or view his case details on wicourts.gov.   Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 10/19/17. sf

DE's mother Carol called to state that she mailed a Money Order on behalf of the DE, but was told by the DE that MO's are not accepted.  Carold was advised that we do accept MO, ck, credit card, or cash in person.  Carol was advised that we did receive her pymt & letter on 8-07-17 & was reminded that the next pymt of $50 is due by 9-05-17.  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf

Letter from Defendant's mother re: Aug. and Sept. payments. RJG
To RMW for review

DE called to state that he just made his pymt via GPN.  DE was advised that we have not receipted it yet, but that we do have the confirmation.  DE was also reminded that he owes another $50 by 8-05-17 in which the DE stated he would be able to make that pymt.  DE inquired about having his pymts reduced due to his decreased employment & was advised that he would need to submit that request in writing & it must be rec'd before his next pymt due date (Sept 5th).  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 7-20-17. cah

DE called to state that he cannot make his $50 pymt today (again, DE was very difficult to understand).  DE was approved to make his pymt by 4:30 pm on 7-14-17 or to submit a request via fax for a deferment.  DE was given info required on his fax, but was advised that he does not need to submit it if he can make his pymt by 7-14-17.  DE stated he can make his pymt by then & was reminded that his next pymt is then due by 8-05-17.  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf
Final notice sent, due 6-15-17. cah

DE called to request an ext until tomrw by Money Order (DE was extremely difficult to hear).  DE was advised that he can utilize the 24 hr pymt options or he may mail out a pymt no later than tomrw.  DE inquired how long mail would take from MO & was advised that I cannot calculate that for him.  DE stated he is working odd jobs & is homeless & will try to have some friends make pymt for him.  DE was advised that he only needs to pay $25 to satisfy his June pymt & then the pymts thereafter are $50/mo until pd in full.  DE was given his case # & pymt info & was advised that he cannot have people make pymts on his behalf w/his SS #.  DE to make pymt by 4:30 pm on 6-07-17.  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf

DE called to state that he is about to make his pymt online & wanted to make sure he didn't have a WA issued.  DE was advised that his pymts are not due until the 5th of ea mo, so he may pay it today if he would like.  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf

From DE on 4-28-17 requesting to make pymt on the 3rd.  DE called back today & requested to make pymt on the 3rd.  DE is approved to make his pymt by 4:30 pm on 5-03-17.  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf
DE called to verify when his next pymt is due as he was paying ahead.  Advised DE his next pymt of $50 is due 4-05-17.  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf

DE called to state that he cannot make a pymt until the end of Mar, but is planning to make larger pymts once employed again.  DE was advised that a pymt at the end of Mar is approved.  Includes 14CF378, 14TR3841.  jaf

DE called to verify that pymts will be pushed out if he pays ahead.  Advised DE that pymts will be pushed out, but not to lose track of where he's at & miss a pymt.  DE stated he will mail out a money order today.  Recommended to DE that he call next wk to verify receipt of pymt & to verify when next pymt wld be due. jaf

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton, DF: James Anthony Garrett appeared.  Court called at 9:45 a.m.  State files an Information.  DE files with the court a Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights Form.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF378.  Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF378 and eliminates the alcohol enhancer.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

- 10 months Jail 
- 9 days credit for time served
- 32 Session AODA with follow through.  If complete will drop jail from 10 months to 9 months.
- 3 years DL Revocation
- 3 years IID.
- Court grants huber for work
- F/F of $2452.00 payable through COC. 
- Court approves payment plan prior to release
20 days to appeal
signed by Defendant and Atty this date. eif
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton, DF: James Anthony Garrett appeared from jail.  Court called at 4:18 p.m.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the court.  Court does not accept plea.  Court continues Plea/Sentencing.  Bond continues in form and amount.  Court adjourned at 4:25 p.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb.  ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: Joseph R. Caton, DF: James Anthony Garrett appeared from jail.  Court called at 3:09 p.m.  S/T of Kaylam Hauenstein.  Direct by ADA Gehler.  DE is identified by Ms. Hauenstein.  Plaintiff's EX. 1 O/R.  Cross by Attorney Caton.  Re-direct by ADA Gehler.  Witness excused.  S/T of Officer Jason Poirier of the River Falls Police Department.  Direct by ADA Gehler.  DE is identified by Officer Poirier.  Cross by Attorney Caton.  Witness excused.  Plaintiff's EX. 2 O/R.  Court finds probable cause and binds the DE over for trial.  Bond continues in form and amount.  Court adjourned at 3:49 p.m. lw  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
14SW168 filed in 14CF378.
Preliminary hearing on September 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 

 *Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY:  Joseph R. Caton, DF:  James Anthony Garrett appeared from jail, via VC.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
